item.title: Ring’s new battery doorbell has head-to-toe video
item.dc:creator: Lauren Forristal
item.description:
Ring announced on Wednesday the next generation of its Battery Doorbell. For $100, customers get extended battery life, color night vision, a head-to-toe view of visitors, and a new push-pin mounting system.  Head-to-toe HD video was previously only available with the Doorbell Plus and Pro models. Now, according to Ring, the Battery Doorbell provides a […]

item.title: Openmart wants to make it easier for enterprises to sell to local businesses
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description:
In 2020, Kathryn Wu launched a side hustle while she was working as a product engineer at Pinterest. Wu started a milk tea company, Ohtea, with the hopes of connecting with local grocery stores and gift shops to get them to carry the tea. She quickly realized how difficult it was to not only be […]

item.title: Grafana Labs raises $270M
item.dc:creator: Frederic Lardinois
item.description:
Grafana Labs, the open-source company that probably powers at least a few operational dashboards in your company, today announced the completion of a primary and secondary transaction worth about $270 million, with the proceeds going to the company and some of its stockholders. The company describes this as an extension to its $240 Series D […]

item.title: Ford says a pickup truck will be the first EV built on its low-cost platform
item.dc:creator: Sean O'Kane
item.description:
The first vehicle that will be built on the low-cost EV platform Ford’s been developing in secret will be a mid-size pickup due out in 2027, the automaker announced Wednesday morning. The news comes as part of a much larger rewriting of Ford’s electrification plans. The company is abandoning a plan to make an all-electric […]

item.title: UK’s competition authority ends probes of Apple and Google but will use incoming powers to ‘resolve app store concerns’
item.dc:creator: Natasha Lomas
item.description:
Apple and Google can take a breath after the U.K. competition watchdog announced Wednesday it’s closing a pair of investigations into their respective mobile app ecosystems, citing administrative priorities. Since March 2021, the U.K. regulator had been investigating Apple’s conduct in relation to the distribution of apps on its iOS and iPadOS mobile devices, with […]

item.title: Story raises $80M at $2.25B valuation to build a blockchain for the business of content IP in the age of AI
item.dc:creator: Ingrid Lunden
item.description:
AI giants like Anthropic, OpenAI and Stability AI have faced a lot of heat over how they’ve scraped data and rode rough-shod over others’ intellectual property when training and operating their foundational models. Now, a startup called Story — which today is announcing $80 million in funding — is bidding to rebalance the scales with […]

item.title: Skyfire lets AI agents spend your money
item.dc:creator: Maxwell Zeff
item.description:
There’s a lot of hype about the promise of AI agents today, but payments are a huge limiting factor. Today, an AI agent might be able to plan a vacation for you independently, but a human has to step in when it’s time to input your credit card information. Skyfire Systems wants to change that. […]

item.title: WeTransfer’s expiry dates haven’t gone away, but you can at least extend them
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description:
WeTransfer’s expiry dates have been a major paint-point for users — especially creatives. The thing is, if you don’t download the files the moment you get the link or email you can easily forget to do so before the link expires. At which point you’ll have to ask for it to be resent — which […]

item.title: India’s trade minister decries e-commerce growth, Amazon’s ‘predatory’ pricing
item.dc:creator: Manish Singh
item.description:
India’s commerce minister Piyush Goyal on Wednesday expressed concern over the rapid growth of e-commerce in the country, warning of potential disruption to small retailers. Speaking at the launch of a report on the impact of e-commerce on employment and consumer welfare in India, Goyal said the projected dominance of online marketplaces in the coming […]

item.title: SleekFlow snaps up $7M to tap the conversational AI opportunity across Asia
item.dc:creator: Kate Park
item.description:
SleekFlow, a Singapore- and Hong Kong-headquartered social commerce platform that has built a conversational AI suite for customer engagement targeted to Asian markets, said Wednesday it had secured a further $7 million in funding. The money will be used to continue developing its AI, as well as penetrate deeper into Southeast Asia and the Middle […]

item.title: The banks that loaned Musk $13B to buy Twitter might be having regrets
item.dc:creator: Kyle Wiggers
item.description:
X, formerly known as Twitter, looks like a pretty bad investment right about now. As readers might recall, Elon Musk borrowed $13 billion from Morgan Stanley, Bank of America and five other major banks to help finance its $44 billion acquisition. According to the WSJ, the deal has since become the worst merger-finance deal for […]

item.title: Cisco employees face a month of silence ahead of second layoff in 2024
item.dc:creator: Lorenzo Franceschi-Bicchierai
item.description:
After tech giant Cisco announced plans for its second round of layoffs this year, employees tell TechCrunch that they will not know if they are affected for close to a month. Earlier this month, Reuters reported that Cisco was planning a second round of layoffs this year, after letting go of around 4,000 workers in […]

item.title: OpenAI signs deal to train on Condé Nast content, surface stories in ChatGPT

item.description:
OpenAI has inked a deal with Condé Nast — the publisher of storied outlets such as The New Yorker, Vogue, and Wired — to surface stories from its properties in OpenAI’s AI-powered chatbot platform ChatGPT and its search prototype SearchGPT.
